data.title: Alex Kingsland, Author at Newcastle School for Boys
data.text:
Year 11 Art gallery visit

The Year 11 Art GCSE group took a trip into Newcastle on Wednesday to visit both the Laing and the Hatton art galleries. The boys spent time drawing copies of some of the pieces and greatly enjoyed an insightful tour of Newcastle University’s Hatton Gallery by a member of their staff. The Laing is hosting an inspirational exhibition of the work of […]

Read More

School aims point to the development of character

The following blog is taken from an article published in Northern Insight magazine’s April edition. A school’s aims are something that should be understood and appreciated by the whole school community: pupils, staff, parents and governors. Independent school inspections judge the extent to which a school is successful in meeting its aims. At Newcastle School for Boys, […]

Read More

Modern Foreign Languages week

Modern Foreign Languages were very much in focus across the school in the week before half term, with boys across a number of year groups taking part in language-themed events. Year 11 were able to explore the science of x-rays in a lesson taught in French by Dr. Tamzin Lafford of Ibex Solutions, Year 8 […]

Read More

Holland football tour 2018

During the half-term, 24 footballers from Year 10 made the short journey across the water for a four-night football tour of Holland. Surviving the overnight ferry to Amsterdam where the most entertainment was to be had in the all-you-can-eat buffet, the boys disembarked on Saturday morning and headed straight to the Amsterdam ArenA for a […]

Read More

How to choose a school for your child

The following blog is an extended version of an article published in Northern Insight magazine’s January edition. During the coming months, places will be offered and decisions made for thousands of children starting new schools in September. How can parents make the right decisions for their children? In choosing a school, you are trying to […]

Read More

Under 15 football v Winterton Community Academy

The Under 15 football team progressed into the semi-final of ESFA Small Schools Trophy after victory against Winterton Community Academy. The boys had travelled down to the game the night before to ensure that their preparations were perfect. They were a credit to the School with their behaviour at the hotel on the evening before the game […]

Read More

Senior swimming gala v RGS and NHSG

On Tuesday of this week, we took two teams to RGS to compete in a friendly gala with the hosts and Newcastle High School for Girls. The standard was very high and our boys swam superbly to compete well in a number of events. The gala started well with Ryan Z securing first place in the intermediate […]

Read More

‘Reading makes you smart’

On Monday morning, author Dan Smith came to talk to all Year 7, 8 and 9 boys about his adventurous life and love of stories. Boys and staff alike enjoyed lively accounts of his boyhood in Asia and Brazil – with accompanying photos of both hitmen and caiman. Throughout he emphasised how the stories told in films, books and in his […]

Read More

Mathematics inspiration lecture

On Tuesday afternoon, a group of Year 11, 12 and 13 attended a Mathematics inspiration lecture at The Northern Stage. This annual event is always a hit, allowing students the chance to hear from interesting speakers talking about how they use mathematics in their life. This year, the boys heard from Rob Eastaway, a mathematician […]

Read More

Year 6 Code Club

Congratulations to the members of Year 6 Code Club who have all completed Module 1 of Scratch. They spent Tuesday’s session sharing the games they’ve created using Scratch programming language and are now looking forward to starting work on their first HTML & CSS project next week. The activities in Code Club encourage challenge-based learning and introduce […]
